Interface for interacting with SAS drives

@param Host host: host object @param String block_name: drive name in /dev/ path @param String config: json file that controls how drive data is

collected and validated

_find_end_device_with_sas_address(sas_add)[source]¶

@param string sas_add @return string: sym link of end device

_get_channel_bus_target_from_sym_link(link)[source]¶

Get drive’s C:B:T from sym link

@param string link: symbolic link of drive

e.g. …host6/port-6:1/expander-6:1/port-6:1:9/end_device-6:1:9/…

@return tuple(str, str, str): tuple of C:B:T

_get_link_speed_from_os(cb_phy_id)[source]¶

Get link speed from OS, addressed as phy-C:B:Phy

@param cbt tuple(str, str, str): tuple of C:B:Phy_ID @return string: represents link speed of drive

_get_phy_id_from_cbt_address(cbt)[source]¶
With SAS expander topology, there may be a target/phy missmatch.

From C:B:T we can get phy identifier

@param cbt tuple(str, str, str): tuple of C:B:T @return string: phy id of drive

SASDriveSnapshot Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.sas.sas_drive_snapshot.SASDriveSnapshot(drive, smart_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(drive, smart_data=None)[source]¶
Collect and store drive data at one point in time. Used to compare

drive data before vs. after test and validate drive health, performance etc.

@param Drive drive: drive object of this snapshot @param str smart_data: SMART data of drive
